sentences.en: A delicious smell of freshly baked bread wafted across the garden.
sentences.cn: 花园中飘过一股刚出炉面包的香味.

sentences.en: A freshly baked cake doesn't cut easily.
sentences.cn: 刚烤好的蛋糕不容易切.

sentences.en: Don't listen to his half - baked ideas.
sentences.cn: 不要听他那思虑不周详的主意.

sentences.en: Freshly baked apple pie makes a tasty dessert.
sentences.cn: 新烤的苹果派是很可口的饭后点心.
他为我们烤了一块蛋糕.

sentences.en: She baked bread in an oven.
She'd baked some bread which made the air smell sweet.
sentences.cn: 她刚烤制了一些面包，空气里都弥漫着一股香味。

sentences.en: That smell of freshly baked bread carries me back!
sentences.cn: 刚烤好面包的香气使我忆起往事!

sentences.en: the delectable smell of freshly baked bread
The players can advertise baked beans, but not rugby boots.
sentences.cn: 球员可以给烤菜豆做广告，但不能代言橄榄球靴。

sentences.en: They're freshly baked. I fetched them from the baker's this morning.
sentences.cn: 它们是刚出炉的。我早上去面包房买回来的。

sentences.en: We baked bread and cake in an oven.
sentences.cn: 我们在炉子里烤面包和蛋糕.
我们为他烤了一些面包.

sentences.en: Why shouldn't Dan eat the cake? After all, he baked it.
sentences.cn: 为什么丹不该吃蛋糕? 不管怎么说还是他做的呢.

words.tran_cn: 面包师；面包工人；（便携式）烘炉
烘焙，烘烤；一次烘焙的量
烤，烘焙；烧硬，烘干（bake的ing形式）

trans.tran_cn: 烘烤制作的，[俚语] 喝醉的，酒醉的
烤( bake的过去式和过去分词 )，烘焙，（将某物）烤硬，（变得）灼热
